messages.m: As I thought. Even without dislodging any, cracked tiles are sparse over here.
Is that intentional?
Those tiles have a unique and highly annoying tendency to detach from my manipulator ring. This has naturally delayed the collection process.
Oh. That sounds like a pain.
Nonetheless, I assure you that this challenge will be saturated by the time of the grand opening.
And may His Noodly Appendage lighten your load.
I'm sorry, I didn't intend to literally walk all over your challenge. I'll try again.
No need. You've earned the right to bypass courses like this.
How so? I'm not sure I deserve any form of special treatment.
You invested time and effort to earn that bridge. I am not one to complain when an investment pays off.
I don't recall investing either of those into this bridge. It took form on its own when I arrived.
You earned it by being diligent in the practice of your faith, did you not?
Well, yes, when you put it that way. What else could it be?
Wait.
You believe in the Flying Spaghetti Monster?
No, but I do recognize a return on an investment when I see one.
Should I be insulted at your aversion to the slightest contact with my challenge? A challenge whose construction process, I remind you, has consumed months of my time.
No, um-
Don't worry, that was in jest. As a matter of fact I'm moderately impressed you managed it.
Oh, haha. In that case, thanks.
Hang on. When you said you spent months building this singular challenge, was that an exaggeration?
I spent months on these challenges collectively, not this challenge alone. The length of time spent is no exaggeration.
I admire your dedication.
Indeed, but it's my hope I can enlist some employees. Do you know where I might find one capable of quickly bridging gaps?
My apologies, but I'm unable to commit that much of my time.
I should mention that I am able to compensate any and all employees extremely handsomely.
You certainly should mention that, but not to me. I already have what little money I need.
When I next talk to the others, I'll make sure to pass along your requests.
I've been talking to the Angel.
My condolences.
Please be serious.
I am. Time spent talking to the Angel is time wasted.
What about time spent attempting to convert the Angel?
If he could learn to see the universe from a Pastafarian perspective, both he and those around him would greatly benefit.
Regardless of the effort required, one can hardly call that a waste.
I'm sorry, but I can hardly imagine the Angel admitting fault, much less making any show of faith.
Thanks so much for the vote of confidence.
I'm merely reminding you that there exist far more profitable uses of your time.
I'll leave you out of it, but I must try.
Hmph. If you insist.
No problem, I finished anyway.
Oh.
Congratulations. I thought I had you there.
In any case...
Oh.
Heh. I take it you didn't expect to encounter that ruse twice in a row?
Not particularly.
That's the beauty of my stratagem: after evading a trap, your natural instinct is to attempt to outsmart me by anticipating something entirely new.
But I anticipated your anticipation of me, letting me subvert your expectations.
I don't buy it.
It was effective, was it not?
Not exactly. You created some uncertainty, but the scenario remained on my mind nonetheless.
Since I was considering the possibility, I spotted it well in advance. Then I chose to walk into it.
Why?
To see what avenues of escape might be available to those without my bridge.
Hmm... ok. And the verdict?
If not for the ease with which this trap can be avoided, I'd chide you for building it.
I can appreciate that reasoning.
I'm afraid I've yet to build the remainder of this training course, but thank you for providing feedback on what currently exists.
Your efforts were invaluable for identifying weaknesses in my product.
It was fun! Thank you for giving me a place to blow off steam.
If you have time, I constructed another set of challenges for which I could use feedback.
Not right now. I should go touch base with the Runner.
Speaking of whom, do you know where she went?
Why are you imposing additional restrictions on yourself?
Well... I mean no offense, but some of your challenges aren't very challenging.
I'm well aware. In order to maximize my potential customer base, I've ensured that these challenges are accessible to all.
Ah.
Then why call them challenges? You usually value precision in your word choice.
Marketing! Members of the general public enjoy believing they are overcoming enormous obstacles.
So marketing isn't just dishonest, it's uncharitable?
No, not at all. I'm, uh... merely keeping in mind that the general public lacks our level of experience.
To them, these challenges will indeed be challenging.
I suppose.
But then you should understand why I chose to impose additional restrictions on myself.
My level of experience is such that your challenge alone failed to challenge me.
Point duly noted.
I don't suppose I could monetize this idea... How much value did these restrictions add to your experience?
I... have no idea how to answer that.
I'm not expecting an exact amount of money. Feel free to round.
No, seriously. I can't answer that.
How was I meant to continue from that point?
I suggest re-evaluating your route.
I realize superior routes exist, but that particular ramp still leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
Then I suggest not tasting that particular ramp.
Did you just-
Heh, touch√©.
Nonetheless, a ramp invites leaping off, and promises the opportunity to land afterwards.
No such promise exists or will exist in any of my contracts.
Then it implicitly promises such. Either way, I took a leap of faith, and my faith went unrewarded. Such experiences are never pleasant.
...I see. However, I project a low monetary impact, so I cannot assign this a high priority.
